definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Silver-headed men sit around kerosene heaters.
sentences.chinese: 满头银发的男人围坐在煤油暖气机。

sentences.english: He is an elderly gentleman, silver-haired, with a twinkle in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位上了年纪的绅士，满头银发，两眼炯炯有神。

sentences.english: Standing up, he saw his mother gazing at him from under her dishevelled white hair.
sentences.chinese: 他站起来，看见妈妈的眼睛在纷乱的银发下望着他。

sentences.english: Introducing the theories and researches of elderly leisure education.
sentences.chinese: 介绍银发族休闲教育之相关理论与研究。

sentences.english: Her grandfather was clean-shaven, with a full head of white hair.
sentences.chinese: 她的外祖父胡子刮的很干净，满头银发。

sentences.english: With multifunctional sticks in hand, the silver-haired noBles can show their outstanding manners.
sentences.chinese: 手持多功能拐杖，令银发贵族风度非凡。

sentences.english: The experience of graying Japan over the past couple of decades is one that Chinese leaders surely want to avoid.
sentences.chinese: 中国领导人肯定不愿重蹈过去几十年银发日本的教训。

sentences.english: Now they have silvered into grand old men.
sentences.chinese: 现在他们已变成满头银发的老人了。

sentences.english: Learning the theories of elderly leisure education.
sentences.chinese: 学习银发族休闲教育之相关理论。

sentences.english: I see a lot of silver foxes out there today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天看到好多魅力银发熟男。

sentences.english: At the front desk, a man with silvery hair stands with a pigeon on his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 而前台那，一银发男子站立着，一鸽子站在他的肩上。

definition: purple qipao gown, the sign of an official position
fine black hair/dried plum (sliced, as cake ingredient)
